intro: Syntherisma microbachne, commonly known as the narrowleaf syntherisma, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are narrow and finely divided, contributing to its delicate appearance. Syntherisma microbachne is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
